newsitem.title: INDIA: Cricket-Kirsten blitz shapes S.African win.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-Kirsten blitz shapes S.African win.

text.p: An aggressive innings of 84 in 81 balls from opener Gary Kirsten fashioned a 47-run victory for South Africa in the opening match of the Titan Cup triangular limited-over series on Thursday.
Man-of-the-match Kirsten hit nine fours and one six as South Africa totalled 261 for seven in their 50 overs at Hyderabad's Lal Bahadur Stadium.
India were then bundled out for 214 in 46.3 overs with paceman Allan Donald claiming three wickets for 43 and Fanie de Villiers and Derek Crookes claiming two wickets apiece.
India never recovered from the swift dismissal of skipper and star batsman Sachin Tendulkar, caught by Cullinan at mid-wicket for 11 trying to force De Villiers off his toes.
Debutant opener Sujith Somasundar soon followed for eight when he failed to beat Kirsten's throw from mid-on, having responded late to Rahul Dravid's call.
Dravid, who scored 62 runs off 87 deliveries, waged a lone battle but found the task dfficult after the departure of Mohammed Azharuddin.

Dravid and Azharuddin steadied the innings with a 67-run third-wicket partnership off 96 balls, briefly threatening to take the game away from South Africa until Azharuddin, on 32, hit off-spinner Crookes straight to deep mid-wicket.
Left-hander Saurav Ganguly, who lifted off-break bowler Pat Symcox for a six over long-off, made 31 before skying a Donald delivery to Symcox at long-on.
South African skipper Hansie Crinje attributed the victory to the opening stand between Kirsten and Andrew Hudson.
"The rousing start meant we would always be in the game," said Cronje. "We were looking towards a total of 280 at one stage but (Anil) Kumble pushed us back with some fine bowling."
Cronje himself contributed an unbeaten 63, ensuring his side a victory within three days of arriving in India.

"It was great to have won the game even before getting over the jet-lag," coach Bob Woolmer said. "Winning the toss was a crucial factor as we did not fancy chasing a target against Indian spinners under floodlights."
